intro: Varronia coriacea, commonly known as the roughleaf varronia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, leathery leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically eaten by birds and other animals. Varronia coriacea is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
